trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of Preanaesthetic Consultation on patient anxiety
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of the Preanaesthetic Consultation on anxiety in patients scheduled for general anaesthesia

interventions.interventions: A one off standard anaesthetic consultation between one anaesthetist and one patient lasting up to half an hour.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anxiety as measured by 100mm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and Pre-operative Intrusive Thought Inventory (PITI) Scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Within two hours of seeing the anaesthetist for a preanaesthetic check

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anxiety as measured by 100mm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and Pre-operative Intrusive Thought Inventory (PITI) Scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Within one hour after seeing the anaesthetist for a preanaesthetic consultation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients waiting to see the anaesthetist prior to general anaesthesia
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: deaf / Blind Unable to give informed consent requires a translator General Anaesthesia contra-indicated

trial_design.concealment: Consectiively numbered sealed opaque envelopes containing the randomisation sequence will be opened once participant has consented to participate

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia, 72 King William Rd, Women's and Children's Hospital, Adelaide, SA 5006

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To assess the effect of the pre-anaesthetic consultation on patient anxiety prior to a planned general anaesthetic.
